result.markdown:
--- title: famCHESS Modeling EDA author: Kendra Wyant editor_options: chunk_output_type: console --- ## Notes This script reads in the processed famCHESS data (see `eda_cleaning.qmd`) and performs modeling checks for assumptions, covariates, mediators, and moderators. ## Setup ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} options(conflicts.policy = "depends.ok") suppressMessages(library(tidyverse)) suppressMessages(library(janitor)) library(Matrix, exclude = c("expand", "pack", "unpack")) library(lme4) theme_set(theme_classic()) devtools::source_url("https://github.com/jjcurtin/lab_support/blob/main/format_path.R?raw=true") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` â„¹ SHA-1 hash of file is "a58e57da996d1b70bb9a5b58241325d6fd78890f" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} path_data <- format_path("studydata/famchess") ``` ::: ## Data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} data <- read_csv(here::here(path_data, "famchess_data_ana.csv"), show_col_types = FALSE) ``` ::: ### Check Assumptions for Analyses of Study Arm Effects patient primary outcome = `per_heavy_drink_days` partner primary outcome = `oq45_scored` patient secondary outcome = `per_days_abstinent` partner secondary outcomes = `relationsatisf_scored` and `abuse_scored` *KW: Cannot run primary and secondary patient models for partners (outcomes don't exist). We could run primary and secondary partner models for patients, but does this make sense?* List of potential covariate variable names: `race_white_only`, `age_c`, `edu_c`, `meetings_yn`, `outpatient_yn_ever`, `er_yn_ever`, `mat_yn`, `inpatient_yn_ever`, `other_psych_treatment_yn`, `other_medications_yn` Set contrasts ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} col_names <- c("fam_and_achess_vs_C", "achess_vs_fam") arm_contrasts <- matrix(c(-2/3, 1/3, 1/3, 0, 1/2, -1/2), nrow = 3, ncol = 2, dimnames = list(levels(data$arm), col_names)) data <- data |> mutate(arm_c = as.factor(arm)) contrasts(data$arm_c) <- arm_contrasts contrasts(data$arm_c) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` fam_and_achess_vs_C achess_vs_fam 0 -0.6666667 0.0 1 0.3333333 0.5 2 0.3333333 -0.5 ``` ::: ::: #### Primary Patient Outcome: `per_heavy_drink_days` ##### Check distribution of residuals *KW: seems normal enough?* ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} model_patient_prim <- lmer(per_heavy_drink_days ~ time_c*arm_c + hdd_0 + (1 + time_c | study_id), data = subset(data, dyad == 2)) tibble(error = residuals(model_patient_prim)) |> ggplot(aes(x = error)) + geom_histogram(color = "black", fill = "light grey", bins = 30) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](eda_modeling_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ##### Look for significant covariates (We will only include covariates that significantly predict the outcome). `race_white_only` - not significant ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} lmer(per_heavy_drink_days ~ time_c*arm_c + hdd_0 + race_white_only + (1 + time_c | study_id), data = subset(data, dyad == 2)) |> sjPlot::tab_model(show.re.var = F, show.icc = F, terms = c("race_white_only")) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
  per heavy drink days
Predictors Estimates CI p
race white only -0.26 -8.95 – 8.43 0.953
N study_id 157
Observations 427
Marginal R2 / Conditional R2 0.282 / 0.765
````` ::: ::: `age_c` - not significant ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} lmer(per_heavy_drink_days ~ time_c*arm_c + hdd_0 + age_c + (1 + time_c | study_id), data = subset(data, dyad == 2)) |> sjPlot::tab_model(show.re.var = F, show.icc = F, terms = c("age_c")) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
  per heavy drink days
Predictors Estimates CI p
age c 0.12 -0.18 – 0.42 0.422
N study_id 156
Observations 424
Marginal R2 / Conditional R2 0.285 / 0.761
````` ::: ::: `edu_c` - not significant ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} lmer(per_heavy_drink_days ~ time_c*arm_c + hdd_0 + edu_c + (1 + time_c | study_id), data = subset(data, dyad == 2)) |> sjPlot::tab_model(show.re.var = F, show.icc = F, terms = c("edu_c")) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
  per heavy drink days
Predictors Estimates CI p

````` ::: ::: #### Primary Partner Outcome: `oq45_scored` Distribution of residuals *KW: Looks fine* ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} model_partner_prim <- lmer(oq45_scored ~ time_c*arm_c + oq45_0 + (1 + time_c | study_id), data = subset(data, dyad == 1)) tibble(error = residuals(model_partner_prim)) |> ggplot(aes(x = error)) + geom_histogram(color = "black", fill = "light grey", bins = 30) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](eda_modeling_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ##### Look for significant covariates (We will only include covariates that significantly predict the outcome). *Checking for sig covariates for partner and patient dyads* `race_white_only` - not significant ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} lmer(oq45_scored ~ time_c*arm_c + oq45_0 + race_white_only + (1 + time_c | study_id), data = subset(data, dyad == 1)) |> sjPlot::tab_model(show.re.var = F, show.icc = F, terms = c("race_white_only")) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}

Look into error* ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} model_partner_sec_2 <- lmer(abuse_scored ~ time_c*arm_c + abuse_0 + (1 + time_c | study_id), data = subset(data, dyad == 1)) tibble(error = residuals(model_partner_sec_2)) |> ggplot(aes(x = error)) + geom_histogram(color = "black", fill = "light grey", bins = 30) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](eda_modeling_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-52-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ##### Look for significant covariates `race_white_only` - not significant ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} model_partner_sec_2_race <- lmer(abuse_scored ~ time_c*arm_c + abuse_0 + race_white_only + (1 + time_c | study_id), data = subset(data, dyad == 1)) sjPlot::tab_model(model_partner_sec_2_race, show.re.var = F, show.icc = F, terms = c("race_white_only")) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
